[purposeful] I'm already isolating the intrusion vector and building a firewall around your broadcast feed to, [calmly], protect the live stream.
[whispering] Thank God.

[playful] Just promise me you'll actually read those security updates I'm going to, [friendly], send you instead of clicking dismiss like you've been, [mocking], doing for the past six months.
[apologetic] You can see my email habits too while you're, [embarrassed], fixing all this chaos I probably could have prevented?
Only the security logs which show you've been, [gently], ignoring every warning the IT department sent about password strength and, [bitter], two-factor authentication requirements.
[cheerful] After watching you work this magic in real time, I'll, [determined], implement every single security measure you recommend.
[proud] Good, because, um, the hackers are getting more sophisticated and, well, next time we might not be so, [quietly], lucky to catch them before they do real damage, you know? [groan]
Thirty seconds to air and my heart is still, [trembling], racing from almost losing everything.
[reassuring] You're clear now and I'll be monitoring everything from here to make sure nothing else, [protective], happens during your broadcast. [sniffle]
